snippet: President Obama emerged from the Group of 20 summit meeting with a few international supporters, but other leaders urged him not to attack without United Nations backing.
abstract: Pres Obama emerges from the Group of 20 summit meeting with a few international supporters, but other leaders urge him not to attack Syria without United Nations backing; deep divisions at the summit raise stakes even further for Obama as he seeks authorization from Congress for an attack.

byline.original: By PETER BAKER and STEVEN LEE MYERS
byline.contributor: Scott Sayare contributed reporting from Paris.

lead_paragraph: President Obama emerged from the Group of 20 summit meeting with a few international supporters, but other leaders urged him not to attack without United Nations backing.

headline.main: Obama Falls Short on Wider Backing for Syria Attack
headline.print_headline: Obama Falls Short on Wider Backing for Syria Attack
